How to download latest Redhat patches

Subscribbe to RHEL 7 subscription

  1. Login to the build server
    ssh pablsv02
  2. Create a directory that denotes today's date
    sudo mkdir -p /var/www/html/sources/04-12-2017
  3. At this time, the subscription while having an issue, you have to follow the below tasks
    1. Unregister from Redhat portal
      sudo subscription-manager unregister
    2. Register to the Redhat portal
      sudo subscription-manager register --username tenauto
    3. Subscribe to one of the Redhat subscriptions
      sudo subscription-manager subscribe --pool=8a85f9815828568c01582c22416e5b84
    4. Refresh the subscription
      sudo subscription-manager refresh
    5. Attach to the subscription
      sudo subscription-manager attach
  4. Download RHEL7 repository
    sudo reposync -p /var/www/html/sources/04-12-2017 -r rhel-7-server-rpms -l
    1. This step will create this directory with all Redhat packages
      /var/www/html/sources/04-12-2017/rhel-7-server-rpms
    2. Create a repository
      sudo createrepo /var/www/html/sources/04-12-2017/rhel-7-server-rpms
  5. Download RHEL7 extras repository
    sudo reposync -p /var/www/html/sources/04-12-2017 -r rhel-7-server-extras-rpms -l
    1. This step will create this directory with all Redhat packages
      /var/www/html/sources/04-12-2017/rhel-7-server-extras-rpms
    2. Create a repository
      sudo createrepo /var/www/html/sources/04-12-2017/rhel-7-server-extras-rpms
  6. Download RHEL7 optional repository
    sudo reposync -p /var/www/html/sources/04-12-2017 -r rhel-7-server-optional-rpms -l
    1. This step will create this directory with all Redhat packages
      /var/www/html/sources/04-12-2017/rhel-7-server-optional-rpms
    2. Create a repository
      sudo createrepo /var/www/html/sources/04-12-2017/rhel-7-server-optional-rpms
  7. At this time, the subscription while having an issue, you have to follow the below tasks
    1. Unregister from Redhat portal
      sudo subscription-manager unregister
    2. Register to the Redhat portal
      sudo subscription-manager register --username tenauto
    3. Subscribe to one of the Redhat subscriptions
      sudo subscription-manager subscribe --pool=8a85f981584fc77301585015801802fe
    4. Refresh the subscription
      sudo subscription-manager refresh
    5. Attach to the subscription
      sudo subscription-manager attach
  8. Download SAP for RHEL7 repository
    sudo reposync -p /var/www/html/sources/04-12-2017 -r rhel-sap-for-rhel-7-server-rpms -l
    1. This step will create this directory with all Redhat packages
      /var/www/html/sources/04-12-2017/rhel-sap-for-rhel-7-server-rpms
    2. Create a repository
      sudo createrepo /var/www/html/sources/04-12-2017/rhel-sap-for-rhel-7-server-rpms
  9. Go ahead and create a new patching document for 04-12-2017
